Not only is Chains of Olympus a worthy addition to the God of War franchise it also stands on its own as a triple-A title in the PSP library.

title: Final Fantasy XIV: Shadowbringers
review: As I said before I cannot recommend Shadowbringers more. The story visuals music vocal performances and gameplay all combine together to create a phenomenal gaming experience. Final Fantasy XIV has only gotten better over time and after playing Shadowbringers I have simply no idea how they are going to better this expansion in the future. It really and truly is that good.

title: DOA2: Hardcore
review: One of the best looking fighters so far for the PS2 it eclipses "Street Fighter EX3" and "Tekken Tag Tournament" for beauty.

title: World of Warcraft: The Burning Crusade
genres: Role-Playing | Massively Multiplayer Online | Massively Multiplayer | Fantasy | Fantasy
review: The new locations characters items and monsters are nothing short of awesome. The voice acting is perfect the sound effects spot-on and the score at times both ominous and uplifting.

title: MLB 10: The Show
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Baseball | Sim | Sim
review: Like the Mega Drive Maddens of the early '90s it's a game absolutely worth learning a new sport for. [May 2010 p.108]

title: Shadow of the Colossus
review: A fresh coat of paint spruces up an already timeless classic that still feels like a breath of fresh air today. [March 2018 p.70]

title: Yoshi's Island: Super Mario Advance 3
review: Its twisted levels beg to be replayed again and again even if you aren't interested in getting that perfect 100%.

title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt - Blood and Wine
review: Geralt's last hurrah is a pleasure to experience; a fitting end to a stunning achievement.

title: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 2005
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Golf | Sim | Sim
review: The courses are stunningly handsome and the golfing action and ball physics are true to life. The game has an almost limitless replay value.

title: ESPN NFL Football
review: A masterful effort. It literally redefines itself within the span of one videogame football season and is a worthy preseason Pro Bowl pick.

title: NCAA Football 2003
review: The three versions of NCAA are virtually identical... The GameCube version doesn’t control quite as comfortably but that’s mainly because the controller layout isn’t as suitable for sports games.

title: The Longest Journey
review: Who would expect a previously unknown Norwegian developer to create such an absorbing and compelling adventure game? The Longest Journey is quite simply one of the best adventures ever made.

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 2
genres: Sports | Alternative | Individual | Skateboarding | Skateboarding | Skate / Skateboard
review: But for sheer fun there are a few games that can compete with Tony Hawk 2's excellent mix of tricks bails and hidden swag.

title: Star Wars Jedi Knight: Dark Forces II
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Great value for money. As the majority of gaming is still a single player experience I can say this game is better than "Quake" its nearest rival and therefore has to be one of the best games on the PC.

title: Batman: Arkham Asylum
review: Batman: Arkham Asylum is the ultimate Batman experience hands down.

title: Halo: Reach
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Halo: Reach is without doubt Bungie's finest Halo game and best of all it has the story and structure to the campaign to finally deliver the Halo experience that some of us have been waiting for since the original Halo: Combat Evolved launched on Xbox back in 2002.

title: Galactic Civilizations II: Dark Avatar
review: It makes a great game that much greater and unquestionably deserves a long-term dedicated spot on any fan of this genre’s hard drive.

title: Mass Effect
genres: Role-Playing | Action RPG | Console-style RPG | Japanese-Style | Western-Style
review: Personally it's the best game I've ever played but even if you're not a hardcore sci-fi nerd like me Mass Effect is a transcendent experience the new standard-setter for what a game can be. You have to play it and that's why we're kinda jealous of you. Even if you memorized all the previews and trailers you're not ready for how awesome this game is. [Holiday 2007 p.58]

title: The Operative: No One Lives Forever
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: An all-around crowd pleaser with great weapons exotic locales and enough mystery to keep you coming back for more.

title: Forza Motorsport 4
genres: Driving | Racing | Simulation | GT / Street | GT / Street | Automobile
review: Forza Motorsport 4 may not be perfect and there are still some things that last year's Gran Turismo 5 either does better or that Forza doesn't do at all. But for the core driving experience technical achievement and level of accessibility Turn 10's effort is nothing short of superb.

title: Resident Evil
review: Long the lord of Street Fighter Capcom's clearly taking a new tack with this killer game and the results are outstanding. Resident Evil stands tall as a topnotch second-generation PlayStation game that's well worth the green.

title: Battlefield 2
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Tactical | Modern | Modern
review: Once you strap into an F/A-18 and rocket over the landscape once you're crouched next to a tank trying valiantly to repair it while bullets ping off of the armor inches above your head once you defend a waypoint and ask for new orders from your commander over the radio all of those nitpicks about map balance or sniper power fade.

title: God of War Collection
genres: Miscellaneous | Action Adventure | Fantasy | Compilation | Compilation
review: It's not a comprehensive museum-style release with tons of improvements new bonus features Chains of Olympus Betrayal etc. but instead a great rerelease of two of the best games of all time in high definition. Here's hoping Sony continues the trend with another critical darling pair of games soon.

title: Celeste
review: The greatest triumph of Celeste is that its best-in-class jumping and dashing is blended beautifully with an important and sincere story and an incredible soundtrack that make it a genuinely emotional game even when your feet are planted firmly on the ground.

title: Madden NFL 2005
review: Madden remains the best in the business at presenting football plays. The playbook and playcalling interface in this year's game are clean easy to read and snap to use. [Sept 2004 p.96]

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3
review: Zipping along at 60 frames per second you almost forget you're looking at a game. [Dec 2001 p.166]

title: Street Fighter IV
review: After years of absence on PC Street Fighter comes back to PC with a flawless version of this outstanding fighting game. SF IV is a well balanced fun and an easy to play but hard to master game but the compatible version adds some welcome visual changes and a fantastic performance in a huge variety of systems.

title: Fallout 3
review: A vast and open world of unimaginable possibilities opens in front of you in Fallout 3. Great story flawless combat system and the option to choose your own way makes it a hot candidate for game of the year. [Nov 2008]

title: Batman: Arkham City
review: Batman: Arkham City is one of those games that rightly garnered much attention with the end of 2011 Game of the Year lists. Maybe it didn't get as much attention from PC gamers but it should. If you want to have the definitive Arkham City experience I'd say PC is the way to go.

title: Fez
review: A masterpiece by any measure. [July 2013 p.89]

title: Planescape: Torment
review: Torment boasts a thoroughly enjoyable story line and I can pretty much guarantee you won't be guessing how it all ends up with any degree of accuracy. This game has very few weaknesses and predictability is certainly not one of them!

title: Gears of War 3
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: The narrative setting is nearly as potent as the gameplay.

title: Killzone 2
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: It's true that Killzone 2 is filled with moments that can handily be described as inspiring awe. Each scene is incredibly well detailed from the gaps in jerry-rigged cover points letting you sneak in a killing headshot to scarred and scratched textures the planet feels entirely believable... Without a doubt Killzone fans action and shooter fans of any stripe will instantly tag this sequel as a powerful contender for best game of 2009. [Feb 2009 p.38]

title: Neverwinter Nights
genres: Role-Playing | PC-style RPG | PC-style RPG | Western-Style
review: It's hard to fathom but what it really boils down to is the fact that gamers may never really have grasped just how faithful an adaptation of the D&D ruleset we are looking at. It is totally accurate in every single detail.

title: Batman: Arkham Asylum
review: Yes this is the Batman you've been waiting for...It's a wonderful experience beginning to end never taking the easy or familiar route and infusing each shift of the story with original ideas that cut no corners. [Oct 2009 p.70]

title: Castlevania: Aria of Sorrow
review: With all of its unique features and amounts of item/soul collection Aria could be considered second to only one other game in the Castlevania series – the masterpiece "Symphony of the Night."

title: No One Lives Forever 2: A Spy in H.A.R.M.'s Way
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: The stealth element which was the source of much frustration has undergone a total overhaul: Virtually every one of the game's 40 missions can be accomplished using guile (instead of brute force). [11 Oct 2002 p.85]

title: INSIDE
review: I loved the implications of Limbo’s ending it’s something that I think about quite often still but Inside’s final chapter is the kind of thing that keeps you awake at night. It’s an unrelenting storm of nightmarish realities that completely blindsides you and then things just get weirder from there.

title: Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver
review: Graphically this could well be the PlayStation's finest hour. The lighting effects are nothing short of incredible with each environment sporting realistic and amazingly effective touches on each surface.

title: Dragon Age: Origins
genres: Role-Playing | PC-style RPG | PC-style RPG | Western-Style
review: If you're into rpgs or rather if you love roleplaying in general there's really no need to waste time reading any reviews of this game. The same goes if you regard games like Planescape: Torment Fallout 2 and the Baldurs Gate-series among the best computer games ever made. Because this game is everything a person like you look for in a game and so much more. Be aware though Dragon Age: Origins is not a revolution of the genre rather it is an evolution where Bioware has refined everything that made them into a formula as close to perfection as possible. Without a doubt one of the strongest Game of the year-candidates so far this year and a game we will remember with warm feelings many years to come.

title: Golden Sun
review: The beautiful quest is probably the richest most intricate RPG ever to have hit a handheld. [Nov 2001 p.144]

title: Rayman Legends
review: Rayman Legends isn’t just good it’s utterly terrific on practically every level. That such a title was once confined to Nintendo’s sickly hardware seems abhorrent although it’s the sort of rare game that would sell a console. An exquisite offering it exudes polish and should appeal to everything sentient within 50 yards of the TV.

title: Mark of the Ninja
review: Nothing short of a stealth masterpiece Mark of the Ninja highlights everything we love about the genre. [Nov 2012 p.77]

title: Disco Elysium
review: A murder mystery set in a rich fictional setting Disco Elysium is told with sweeping profundity and hilarious absurdity. With no combat to impede story progression this is a choice-driven role-playing adventure that deftly raises the bar of quality for the medium.

title: World Soccer Winning Eleven 8 International
review: Where "FIFA" feels like hockey with soccer players Winning Eleven 8 feels like the year's first entrant for best sports game of 2005.

title: SteamWorld Heist: Ultimate Edition
review: If you missed it the first time around the Switch is a great place to play this truly fantastic game. [Issue #32 – March/April 2018 p. 20]

title: The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds
genres: Action RPG | Role-Playing | Action Adventure | General | Action RPG | Open-World
review: No two ways about it: if you own a 3DS this Zelda is a must. It’s an intelligent and entertaining action game brimming with fresh ideas and fascinating worlds. [Issue#237]

title: NieR: Automata - Game of the YoRHa Edition
review: If you've never played NieR: Automata this package is the perfect way to experience this bizarre and haunting masterpiece.

title: Dark Souls II
review: You'll get everything the fantastic console version had: a feeling of insecurity respect for the apparently insurmountable an unparalleled combat system. A nigh on perfect game.

title: Castlevania: Circle of the Moon
review: Set against a myriad of beautifully rendered 2D environments the detailed visuals convey a feeling of dread.

title: Resident Evil 2
review: The stunning graphics incredible survival horror combat and wonderfully eerie setting make picking up a copy of Resident Evil 2 a no-brainer.

title: Far Cry 3
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Aside from the occasional texture glitch or stray enemy phasing into a rock (a problem easily solved with well-placed explosives) Far Cry 3 is a technically brilliant and expertly balanced gameplay experience that offers an immense amount of content and a high degree of polish. At the time of writing I have put nearly 60 hours into it across two playthroughs and will probably play it a third time on PC later on. I suggest you do the same.

title: Dark Souls II
review: At the end of the day Dark Souls II uses more subtle changes to find its own flavor and place in the series as a whole rather than reinventing the wheel.

title: Shovel Knight: Treasure Trove
review: Treasure Trove is packed to the brim with content and the different ways you can play through these games is wonderfully broad. Whether its co-op or solo handheld or docked – it’s up to you. I don’t care. Just go play Shovel Knight.

title: flower
review: The sheer simplicity of flower makes it a difficult game not to fall in love with. It’s a relaxing calming and curiously moving experience that has the power to change the way that you look at the outside world. Moreover the improved motion sensors inside the DualShock 4 coupled with the enhanced horsepower of Sony’s fresh hardware breathe new life into the experience ensuring that this former PS3 favourite blossoms all over again on the PS4.

title: Mario Kart DS
genres: Driving | Racing | Arcade | Kart | Kart | Automobile
review: The online shortcomings are annoying yes but very minor and they are more than made up for by the amazing single-player content and local WiFi gameplay.

title: Call of Duty
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Third-Person | Historic | Tactical | Historic | Arcade
review: An extraordinary game that any action fan will go nuts over. Everything from the graphics to the sound to the action itself Infinity Ward and Activision have taken the genre to an all-new level and it's truly something special. [Dec 2003 p.88]

title: Madden NFL 2004
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Football | Sim | Sim
review: Looking for more depth? Take the owner's seat and relocate your team set concession stand prices in your new stadium and hire your coaching staff. Ditka: Send us your resume. [Sept 2003 p.33]

title: Mario Golf
review: Even while he's just holding a golf club Mario still has plenty of style and charisma - as do his similarly golf mad companions that join him. Forget all the so-serious golf sims and have a round of Mario Golf.

title: Crash Bandicoot 3: Warped
review: A very strong contender for PlayStation game of the year. Its "rowdy rowdy" gameplay will keep your head spinning for days.

title: Assassin's Creed II
review: Few games so deftly balance the contrasting qualities achieved here. It's at once both epic and intimate earnest and lighthearted. The scale of it is truly magnificent but often its largest and most moving moments come from the smallest and most carefully composed scenes.

title: Project Gotham Racing 2
review: A brilliant game for Xbox and Xbox Live! quite possible the finest racing title ever created.

title: NBA 2K12
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Basketball | Sim | Sim
review: Beyond its highly polished gameplay the sheer breadth and depth of what 2K12 offers will keep basketball fans happily playing for hundreds of hours. [Dec 2011 p.72]

title: The Sims 2
genres: Simulation | Miscellaneous | Virtual Life | Virtual | Virtual Life
review: Far more than the original this truly is a game that can be enjoyed by anyone and should be tried by everyone.

title: F1 2020
review: Factoring in all of the improvements that have been made to the handling model and racing experience in this game I've had more fun in the My Team mode races and time trial in F1 2020 than in any other previous F1 game before it.

title: Animal Crossing: New Horizons
review: The latest Animal Crossing is also the best full of life charm and near-endless ways to make your very own island paradise.

title: Final Fantasy XIV: Shadowbringers
review: Shadowbringers is a step above anything that has come before it. The perfect blend of captivating gameplay and a truly memorable story that rivals those heralded by fans for decades. It’s time to step out of the shadows and become what you must Final Fantasy XIV; the best MMORPG in the world.

title: World of Warcraft: Cataclysm
genres: Role-Playing | Massively Multiplayer Online | Massively Multiplayer | Fantasy | Fantasy
review: Cataclysm doesn't just make WOW better. It does something even more valuable than that; it renews it. It fires your excitement at starting on that long road one more time and invites you to relish the journey just as much as you'll lose yourself in its ending.

title: Half-Life 2
review: Real 'bullet-time' isn't ballet; it's no-holds carnage that ends with a radio-transmitted flatline. It's one man making a difference; it's one game making a noise. Half-Life 2 is all that - and more.

title: NCAA Football 2003
review: The three versions of NCAA are virtually identical... The main points involve graphics and the Xbox version clearly looks the best sporting the crispest details richest colors and best lighting.

title: Rayman 2: The Great Escape
review: Regardless of whether Rayman is climbing swinging or hovering like a helicopter the control never once loses its smooth seamless feel. Rayman 2 brings the same kind of fun that you will find in other great games of the genre while at the same time creating its own identity and following.

title: Bayonetta
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Beat-'Em-Up | Fantasy | Beat-'Em-Up | Linear
review: A beautiful and graceful fighting game that lets imagination loose and winks before slapping Dante Kratos and every other hero back to the drawing board. [Christmas 2009 p.90]

title: Diablo III: Ultimate Evil Edition
review: Diablo 3 Ultimate Evil Edition is undoubtedly an essential package including updates made available throughout the two years of its existence that make this game almost perfect.

title: Overwatch
review: All in all Overwatch continues to feel unique regardless of how much time you spend with it and despite the low number of available modes to participate in. I’m genuinely impressed by what Blizzard has managed to do here and I think you will be too.

title: Far Cry 3
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Ubisoft's balance of open world gameplay and FPS action really hits the mark and overall the game does a fantastic job in providing players with an interesting immersive gaming experience.

title: ICO
review: Easily the most addictive game I have played this year on either console or computer and would be a welcome addition to any adventure gamer's collection.

title: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Advanced Warfighter
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Tactical | Modern | Modern
review: A game of monolithic proportions... It is the best use of your 360 currently on the market and whether you know it yet or not the reason you bought one in the first place.

title: FIFA Soccer 12
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Soccer | Sim | Sim
review: From standard Exhibitions to the Ultimate Team card game everything about FIFA 12 is superb. This is sports gaming excellence personified.

title: World of Goo
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Action | Puzzle | General | Puzzle | General
review: World of Goo's mix of ingenious physics-based puzzles and witty colorful presentation make it a game almost everyone should check out. It goes by fast -- you can get through most of the puzzles in 5-6 hours -- but for $20 there's little excuse not to check out this World.

title: Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga
review: Superstar Saga is the perfect mix of turn-based combat adventuring and platforming all in one.

title: Shovel Knight
review: I would say it’s a must play for anyone old enough to remember blowing on a cartridge but that would be selling it short. Nostalgia certainly enhances the experience but this is a great game for anyone.

title: Tony Hawk's Underground
review: From reasonably good-looking graphics to kick-ass sounds (dig those funky KISS tunes!) and more gameplay modes (online as well as off) than most players will know what to do with the PS2 version of THUG is the most complete extreme sports title ever made for any system EVER.

title: Marvel vs. Capcom 2
review: Of all the incarnations of the versus series never before have I had so much fun said "WHOA!" so many times per match and been so frustrated as to which characters to pick.

title: Ape Escape
review: This is one of those games that just screams out fun whenever you play even though technically apes aren't the same as monkeys. An absolutely essential part of any platform fan's collection.

title: Syphon Filter
review: The atmosphere is captured perfectly the cinemas are perfectly interleaved with the action really drawing you into Gabe's chaotic world.

title: Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story
genres: Role-Playing | Action RPG | Console-style RPG | Console-style RPG | Japanese-Style
review: The adventure is lengthy the characters are entertaining and this is truly a game that you’ll want to keep in your pocket for any free minute you find yourself with. DS owners should not miss out on what could certainly be the best handheld RPG of 2009.

title: Trials Evolution
genres: Driving | Racing | Simulation | Motorcycle | Automobile | Street | Street
review: Trials Evolution is really the best Xbox Live Arcade game to date. It is challenging it is fun and the new courses are brilliant. For 1.200 Microsoft Points you will get a huge amount of content.

title: Grand Theft Auto IV: The Lost and Damned
review: This is how DLC’s got to be. Over 20 new missions new characters new weapons and save points during missions (finally!) make this an extraordinary add on for an extraordinary game. Sadly it’s exclusive for 360.

title: FIFA Soccer 12
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Soccer | Sim | Sim
review: From standard Exhibitions to the Ultimate Team card game everything about FIFA 12 is superb. This is sports gaming excellence personified.

title: Monster Hunter: World - Iceborne
review: Quotation forthcoming.

title: Spelunky
review: I think I could play Spelunky forever and now that it has come home to PC assuring its permanence I believe I will.

title: FIFA Soccer 10
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Soccer | Sim | Sim
review: FIFA 10 is all the best a football fan could imagine you simply have to have it. The score is the right prize for a nearly perfect game that deserves the right prize for the work done in the last years that brought the average arcade game of the past to the nearest thing to real football actually available. You'll stop playing FIFA 10 only when FIFA 11 will be on shelves. Great job EA great job Moore great job Rutter. You have to play it!

title: Ratchet & Clank: Going Commando
review: Has it where it counts - fast action and plenty of it. Highly polished and loads of fun if you want an example of platforming paradise Insomniac has delivered.

title: NBA Street Vol. 2
review: Multiplayer is a hoot rebounding is spot-on the Career mode lets you unlock legends and the new defensive counters add loads of strategy. But most important the first game's rubber-band logic that kept every game close has been abandoned. [May 2003 p.94]

title: Tennis 2K2
review: The intuitive controls have been retained but to enhance the original's sim-like feel a slice button has been added and the serves are a little more difficult to perfect.

title: Black & White
review: It's the sort of game that comes around once every few years and totally changes the gaming landscape.

title: Fallout 3
review: This is the kind of hugely ambitious game that doesn't come around very often and when it does you'd be a fool not to play it and enjoy the hell out of it and look forward to the day (next-next-gen?) when the fidelity of open-world RPGs takes another big step closer to the uncanny valley's far side.

title: The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker HD
review: Wind Waker HD is a must play game not just for Zelda fans but for every gamer.

title: ESPN NFL 2K5
review: With better graphics deeper gameplay a polished ESPN interface to die for and an outrageously low price ESPN NFL 2K5 offers the most bang for your gaming dollar period.

title: Portal
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Just as Valve's Half-Life 2 is the moody loner to Halo 3's high-school quarterback Portal is smarter cooler funnier and more sinister than almost any game this year.

title: Tetris Effect
review: A euphoric almost religious game and one that will make you wonder what you've been doing playing other games.

title: The Legend of Zelda: Phantom Hourglass
review: There are many excellent games on the DS but few masterpieces. This one though is a masterpiece. And worth every penny you'll pay for it. [JPN Import]

title: MVP Baseball 2004
review: Never before has a sports game improved so much and added so many new features in a single season. It may not be the league-leader in every category but excellent performances across the board make it the best baseball game of the year. [May 2004 p.86]

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3
review: Despite only having six main stages THPS 3 is a game that will last for a surprisingly long time.

title: Dance Dance Revolution
review: Dance games will probably never get any better than this.

title: NHL 2001
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Ice Hockey | Sim | Sim
review: It has improved graphics better controls smarter AI and a new momentum meter that adds to the drama.

title: Advance Wars: Dual Strike
review: This game has it all; the gameplay is solid and far more balanced than those of previous games the many characters both return and make memorable debuts and wide variety of new weapons features and gaming modes will keep you coming back to quench your thirst for mass destruction. Accordingly this game blows the competition out of the water.

title: Rayman Legends
review: Rayman Legends is a legendary game just like its name. With lots of interesting and hard boss fights surprising and colorful scenes it looks simply amazing. It could be better with online co-op mode but even without that the game is still just fine.

title: MLB 11: The Show
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Baseball | Sim | Sim
review: Lord knows how long the San Diego boys can continue trumping themselves year after year but for now their golden touch shows no sign of fading. [June 2011 p.106]

title: NieR: Automata - Become as Gods Edition
review: XBox One owners have no excuse to miss out on this game. It is one of the best examples of video games as a medium of entertainment and needs to be played by every person possible. I cannot stress enough how important this game is or how good it is.

title: Jak and Daxter: The Precursor Legacy
review: Good lord is this a beautiful game. [Jan 2002 p.124]

title: Star Wars Rogue Leader: Rogue Squadron II
review: The visuals are astounding the challenge is incredible and the action is nonstop. [Nov 2001 p.140]

title: Bastion
review: The Switch release plays just as smoothly as any modern game. No frame drops are present and it works beautifully in handheld mode. While there is no new content with this release it still feels right at home on the Switch. If you’ve played Bastion in the past or if you’ve missed out on the previous releases I wholeheartedly recommend Bastion for anyone looking for a fantastic action RPG.

title: Monster Hunter: World
review: Make no mistake Monster Hunter World is one of the best games on the Xbox One and with the promise of free updates will remain one of the most played games of 2018.

title: Stephen's Sausage Roll
review: This isn’t a game for everybody. It’s brutally difficult and requires incredible patience and lateral thinking. However for puzzle aficionados interested in a casual but challenging experience Stephen’s Sausage Roll is one of the best puzzlers available.

title: Velocity 2X
genres: Shooter | Scrolling | Action | General | Shooter | Scrolling | Shoot-'Em-Up | Vertical
review: Velocity 2X offers the perfect mix of side-scrolling puzzle-platforming and top-down shooting action. With perfect controls beautiful visuals and an amazing soundtrack.

title: Burnout Revenge
review: Burnout: Revenge proves once again why it is the ultimate spectacle for those of us who just want to feel the rush. You know you're playing a great game when even the pauses in the action are filled with rockin' music flashy video and big sound effects.

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3
genres: Sports | Alternative | Individual | Skateboarding | Skateboarding | Skate / Skateboard
review: My weapon of choice is the PS2 mostly because of the Dual Shock 2 which I think is the perfect controller for THPS3...While the network play [of the PC version] is damn fun I'm not sure if it's robust enough to warrant the $50.00-or-so expenditure.

title: NBA 2K2
review: NBA 2K2 still showcases the best basketball game out there - steady game play dazzling visuals realistic sound.

title: NCAA Football 2002
review: An outstanding game with excellent gameplay and a deep set of features. Finally the PS2 has a genuine A+ sports title.

title: Unreal Tournament
review: UT fares better than "Quake III" in three of the categories: lag amount of people allowed to play and levels.

title: Deus Ex
review: For a complete package of plot style depth and action few games rival "Deus Ex."

title: Donkey Kong 64
review: Donkey Kong stands tall over other similar-minded action titles. It's one of those Rare games that makes you remember why you liked video games so much in the first place.

title: Panzer Dragoon Orta
review: Looks beautiful and is one of the best shooters we've ever played.

title: Portal: Still Alive
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: By making the game available to a broader audience and including several excellent challenges (along with all-new Achievements) Portal isn't merely alive -- it's stronger than ever.

title: Half-Life 2: Episode Two
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: I've selected these examples at near-random to avoid spoiling truly standout showpieces. Episode Two's entire five-hour experience -- vivid emotionally engaging and virtually unsurpassed -- is full of them.

title: Fez
review: Download it right away and get ready to be wowed.

title: Braid
review: An unforgettable game experience that brings a set of various fantastic puzzles. Braid experiments with storytelling and playability itself succeeds on all fronts. [May 2009]

title: The Chronicles of Riddick: Escape From Butcher Bay - Developer's Cut
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: The guards prisoners and Riddick himself are some of the most realistic looking polygon characters you'll see this year. The level of detail in the facial contortions alone are benchmark raising.

title: Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 4
review: An outstanding achievement in gaming. There’s no question that this is going to be one of my top games of the year and any fan of JRPGs should be playing it when it’s released next week.

title: Hollow Knight
review: There's never a low point. Only the desire for more. [Issue #35 – September/October 2018 p. 17]

title: MLB 09: The Show
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Baseball | Sim | Sim
review: For the hardcore fan the new additions are more than worth the price of admission whether you are utilizing batting practice adjusting your now expanded roster or just enjoying new graphical touches such as post game highlight reels. MLB 09 The Show is a significant improvement over last years fantastic effort and I can just wonder what the boys have up their sleeves for next season. I'm sure it'll be a hit.

title: Blast Corps
review: When it comes to video game destruction for brains and brawn Blast is definitely the master.

title: Shovel Knight
review: Shovel Knight is at the risk of repetition brilliant beautiful stuff.

title: Ori and the Will of the Wisps
review: No game is perfect and I don’t believe giving a game a 10/10 means that it is perfect. However I believe that Ori and the Will of the Wisps is a masterpiece that deserves the highest praise that I can give it. Moon Studios is a shining example that a small team working with a lot of heart and passion can create something beautiful fun and challenging. It expands on the original in every way and you will not find a better game in the Metroidvania genre. I personally can’t wait to dive back into the game on a harder difficulty.

title: MVP Baseball 2004
review: Never before has a sports game improved so much and added so many new features in a single season. It may not be the league-leader in every category but excellent performances across the board make it the best baseball game of the year. [May 2004 p.86]

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 4
review: The speed has also been cranked so that skaters fly through the levels at an insane velocity. [Nov 2002 p.50]

title: Sid Meier's Civilization III
review: It was difficult to write this review because each time I started the game to check on some detail six hours mysteriously vanished. [Jan 2002 p.92]

title: NFL 2K2
review: Continues to deliver well-balanced pigskin fun with awesome graphics intuitive controls numerous options and lightning-fast onscreen action.

title: WWF SmackDown! 2: Know Your Role
review: Infinite playability and attention to the he-men details make this a treat. [Mar 2002 p.34]

title: LIMBO
review: A haunting puzzler brimming with ideas Limbo is easily the platform's greatest successor to Braid. [Oct 2010 p.118]

title: Ori and the Blind Forest: Definitive Edition
review: Even though I'd already replayed Ori for the fifth time last year when I heard it was coming to Switch I wanted to run through it all over again without question! [Issue #43 – November/December 2019 p. 21SW]

title: Mark of the Ninja
review: An expertly-crafted love letter to stealth gaming and so far one of the year's best titles. [Nov 2012 p.73]

title: Silent Hunter III
review: This is a classic game that deserves to be mentioned in the same breath as "F-19" "Longbow 2" and "European Air War."

title: Bayonetta
review: This PC release brings with it a gorgeous graphic update with smooth 60fps and 4K visuals you can see every detail the development team created for you. This is truly the definitive edition of this game and one that you have to pick up if you are a PC gamer whether you played Bayonetta when it launched originally or not. Bayonetta is a great hack and slash that takes what works in other games and adds its own unique flair and style which pays off handsomely.

title: Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood
review: Assassin's Creed Brotherhood is a more than a worthy addition to the series canon. The similar setting of renaissance Italy will trick folks into assuming this is a half-arsed expansion but honestly this feels like Assassin's Creed 2.99. Don't be fooled by Brotherhood's cunningly familiar disguise. Mark it as a fresh target pounce and take it down. [January 2011 p66]

title: Okami
review: Unique and captivating characters await you at every flower laden step. From combat to exploration every action rewards the player with items experience or another breathtaking look at this gorgeous world.

title: Super Meat Boy
review: Super Meat Boy's difficulty will likely turn off some gamers. But if you like your 2D platformers challenging and rewarding then you'll be hard pressed to find a better game out there.

title: Grand Theft Auto: Chinatown Wars
review: My favourite handheld game of all time. It's funny it's full of great ideas and above all else it's wickedly fun. Whether you're a GTA veteran or someone who's never played one of these games before you should know that this is one of the best games available for your PSP - or indeed for your DS. To miss it would be criminal.

title: Dead Space 2
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: I was expecting Dead Space 2 to be a great game but it exceeded my expectations with beautiful creative environments and a large array of both enemies and weapons with which to kill them.

title: Pikmin 2
review: Flat-out weird does not begin to describe this highly addictive title. You become so attached to your herds that it kind of hurts when you lose a Pikmin or two to drowning or carnivorous giant beetles. It's like losing a child. A fat little purple child with a flower budding out of his forehead.

title: Okami HD
review: Overall Ōkami HD is an experience that should not be missed. It's stylized graphics and engaging gameplay really show that this game was ahead of its time with its initial release. Old and new players alike owe it to themselves to download it and either relive the adventure or experience it for the first time. With its updated visuals and awesome gameplay this is one that should not be missed.

title: NBA 2K17
review: The action on the court is fast fluid and accessible but with enough depth and detail to keep you hooked for the long haul.

title: Madden NFL 2002
review: The extensive Franchise Mode (which includes this year’s Houston Texans) is the best in any football game ever and the Madden Cards once again hype the game’s replayability.

title: Grandia II
review: Luckily the lame story is the one glaring flaw in an otherwise stupendous role-playing game.

title: Geometry Wars: Retro Evolved 2
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Static | Static | Shoot-'Em-Up | Top-Down
review: Even if you've grown tired of the seemingly endless cavalcade of dual-joystick shooters that Geometry Wars: Retro Evolved's success spawned on Xbox Live Arcade the sequel is well-worth its $10 price tag.

title: Sid Meier's Civilization V
review: My favorite Civilization to date. Hex tiles and no stacking makes combat fun and more tactical. The new systems work incredibly well without altering what makes the game Civilization. Civ V is an excellent game.

title: Super Mario 3D Land
review: There's no question – if you own a 3DS this is the best game on the platform and instantly worthy of a purchase. It's one of the best portable platformers I've ever played (and I've had my fair share) and an almost shockingly good Mario title on any platform.

title: Mario Kart 8 DLC Pack 2
review: I genuinely have no complaints about the Animal Crossing DLC for Mario Kart 8 and highly recommend getting this content as well as the first pack if you haven’t yet to expand on your Mario Kart experience.

title: Falcon 4.0: Allied Force
genres: Simulation | Flight | Modern Jet | Modern Jet | Combat
review: Finally a Falcon 4 that works as advertised straight out of the box. Includes the best features of the Falcon mod-community along with numerous new features. Superb work. [Nov 2005]

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Shooter | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | General | First-Person | Sci-Fi
review: There are only a few games this year we suggest to 16-yrs old gamers and their fathers together. Human Revolution for sure is a Game of the Year nominee. [Oct 2011]

title: XCOM: Enemy Unknown
genres: Strategy | Turn-Based | General | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | General | Tactics
review: By virtue of how it stokes more parts of my brain than any game of the past decade I’m inclined to consider XCOM: Enemy Unknown one of the most important titles of this generation. This game will test your disaster-management skills levy you with suffocatingly difficult choices on how to spend your resources and cause you to grow so fond of your chess pieces that each skirmish takes on the flavour of a Whedonesque drama.

title: Metroid Prime 3: Corruption
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: From the action-packed intro to its ultimate conclusion Metroid Prime 3: Corruption is bursting at the seams with "win" material.

title: Monster Hunter: World
review: Moving to real consoles has paid off for Monster Hunter. The fifth installment is bigger nicer and funnier (a bit). In addition a number of free addons will extend the entertainment for another dozens of hours. [Issue#283]

title: Flight Simulator 2002
review: It's unquestionably FS 2002's surprisingly glorious and massively modified visual presentation that makes this the finest civilian flight simulation ever to appear.

title: Banjo-Tooie
review: Speaking of play mechanics I can honestly say that I haven't had this much fun playing a game in a very long time. Not only do the controls harbor the utmost precision but the camera has been refined as well.

title: Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons
review: The brothers' commitment to their goal and to each other is so strong the various parts of this game so superbly crafted and woven together that it's hard not to feel deeply touched when you finally reach the end of the road and see how deftly this game marries its gameplay to its themes in a way few have before.

title: Dota 2
genres: General | Fantasy | MOBA | Strategy | Real-Time | MOBA
review: A great PvP game that offers some of the most intriguing and nuanced team combat around.

title: World Soccer Winning Eleven 8 International
review: Even lacking that [online] option WE 8 stands as the best soccer game of all time. It looks fantastic and plays out of this world.

title: TimeSplitters 2
review: As a PS2 shooter it's the best I've ever played - I can't emphasize that point enough.

title: Guild Wars 2
genres: General | Role-Playing | Massively Multiplayer Online | Massively Multiplayer | Fantasy | Fantasy
review: So is Guild Wars 2 the MMO messiah everyone is waiting for? Maybe not. What it is though is the first MMO in years that really does the "massively multiplayer" part justice. This is a gigantic sprawling world for explorers with countless wonderful stories and characters all backed by a gameplay concept that treats all players as equals. And that's just the basis of what Guild Wars 2 is.

title: Forza Motorsport 2
genres: Driving | Racing | Simulation | GT / Street | GT / Street | Automobile
review: It really can teach you to appreciate the nuances of racing and may even renew your love of cars. For a game like this we think that's the best compliment we can give it.

title: Tales From The Borderlands: Episode 5 - The Vault of the Traveler
review: Episode 5 is a home run for Telltale and the entire Tales from the Borderlands series. Witty heart-wrenching and so damn well-written. The perfect final episode to a perfect series. Now we'll wait for season 2.

title: Pushmo
review: Pullblox is one of the finest titles currently available for the 3DS and even in a world where iPhone games can cost under a pound there's no questioning the value for money that Pullblox provides; it's really is a massive game with near-endless customisability.

title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt - Hearts of Stone
review: Ultimately Hearts of Stone sets the standard for what we should expect from premium content and not just because of its price tag. This is DLC that puts many retail releases to shame.

title: Metal Gear Solid HD Collection
review: Metal Gear Solid HD Collection has probably the highest quality-price ratio you can get. You'd be mad to miss out on what's on offer.

title: Viewtiful Joe
review: A slightly reduced retail price and the cool unlockable stuff make VJ for PS2 one of the best buys I've seen all year. It offers something great for those of you that already Joe and something truly epic for those of you that don't.

title: Madden NFL 2005
review: In its 15th year this well-oiled machine enters the 2005 season with one of the finest football games ever crafted. Raising the bar to an unheard of level Madden 2005 is football at its very best. [Aug 2004 p.73]

title: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 2003
review: Players will spend most of their time in the new Play Now mode. Here you're given 50 scenarios where you are immediately thrown into the heart of competition. [Dec 2002 p.90]

title: Freedom Force
review: The best superhero-themed game to ever crash through the screen of your PC. [10 May 2002 p.84]

title: NBA 2K2
review: EA's "NBA Live" has better character models and Microsoft's "Inside Drive" has the best-looking arenas but Segas NBA 2K2 is the complete package for basketball on the Xbox.

title: Colin McRae Rally 2.0
review: Perhaps the most gorgeous addictive and exceptionally challenging rally title ever to hit a home console.

title: FIFA Soccer 13
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Soccer | Sim | Sim
review: The best change is an interesting contradiction that gives you more control while taking some away.

title: Into the Breach
review: Turn-based strategy game with exceptionally original game mechanics well-designed maps and great core gameplay that guarantees a long entertainment. [Issue#284]

title: LIMBO
review: Limbo is simply one of the most impressive titles that PSN has to offer and at $15 it's an experience that no gamer should pass up. [Oct 2011 p.80]

title: GTR 2
genres: Driving | Racing | Simulation | GT / Street | GT / Street | Automobile
review: I’ve just had so much fun with this game that it’s practically renewed my interest in PC racing single handedly.

title: Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice
review: Though Sekiro feels impossibly hard at times the level of euphoria you experience when delivering a death blow to a tricky boss or when you finally clear a castle grounds of all enemies is almost unparalleled.

title: Yakuza 0
review: It may take a while to get going at first for new players but get over that first hour of pretty much just cutscenes and the game completely opens up into one of the finest examples of storytelling in gaming. This along with the sheer abundance of side activities and people asking for a punch makes Yakuza 0 an exquisite game and a perfect benchmark for newcomers to dive straight into.
